segment.source: New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet
segment.target: New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet

segment.source: New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet
segment.target: New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet

segment.source: New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet
segment.target: New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet

segment.source: Use New-RequestForUpdate to create a new request for update (RFU) based on a given update type and firmware submission ticket ID.
segment.target: Use New-RequestForUpdate to create a new request for update (RFU) based on a given update type and firmware submission ticket ID.

segment.source: The firmware submission must be signed successfully.
segment.target: The firmware submission must be signed successfully.

segment.source: Before you can create an RFU, you’ll need to prepare the firmware submission, using Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet with TypeOfSubmission set to image.
segment.target: Before you can create an RFU, you’ll need to prepare the firmware submission, using Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet with TypeOfSubmission set to image.

segment.source: For more info about the image submission process, see Submit binaries to be retail signed.
segment.target: For more info about the image submission process, see Submit binaries to be retail signed.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Submit separate RFUs for each Phone-Operator pairing.
segment.target: Submit separate RFUs for each Phone-Operator pairing.

segment.source: For example, if you have two phones on a specific Mobile Operator (MO), you will need to submit two RFUs.
segment.target: For example, if you have two phones on a specific Mobile Operator (MO), you will need to submit two RFUs.

segment.source: If you have a device on four different MOs, you will need to submit four RFUs.
segment.target: If you have a device on four different MOs, you will need to submit four RFUs.

segment.source: This is the syntax for New-RequestForUpdate:
segment.target: This is the syntax for New-RequestForUpdate:

segment.source: Syntax
segment.target: Syntax

segment.source: Parameters
segment.target: Parameters

segment.source: Typically, the only parameters that are specified for this cmdlet are FirmwareSubmissionTicketId, RequestForUpdateType, SourceFirmwareSubmissionTicketId, OemDeviceName, and MOId.
segment.target: Typically, the only parameters that are specified for this cmdlet are FirmwareSubmissionTicketId, RequestForUpdateType, SourceFirmwareSubmissionTicketId, OemDeviceName, and MOId.

segment.source: The FirmwareSubmissionTicketId property is the ID of the firmware submission ticket ID being associated with the new RFU.
segment.target: The FirmwareSubmissionTicketId property is the ID of the firmware submission ticket ID being associated with the new RFU.

segment.source: The RequestForUpdateType must be set to one of these two values:
segment.target: The RequestForUpdateType must be set to one of these two values:

segment.source: RequestForUpdateType
segment.target: RequestForUpdateType

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: RetailServicing
segment.target: RetailServicing

segment.source: Used by OEMs to make updates available over the air (OTA) to MOs for lab trials and technical acceptance.
segment.target: Used by OEMs to make updates available over the air (OTA) to MOs for lab trials and technical acceptance.

segment.source: Updates in preview are published to the live production environment in accordance with published targets, after receiving the OEM approval (go live).
segment.target: Updates in preview are published to the live production environment in accordance with published targets, after receiving the OEM approval (go live).

segment.source: Trial
segment.target: Trial

segment.source: Used by OEMs to test OTA updates and evaluate the quality of their RFUs prior to submitting a retail servicing submission.
segment.target: Used by OEMs to test OTA updates and evaluate the quality of their RFUs prior to submitting a retail servicing submission.

segment.source: It's also used to test updates for commercializing new devices.
segment.target: It's also used to test updates for commercializing new devices.

segment.source: It is not intended for MO lab trials.
segment.target: It is not intended for MO lab trials.

segment.source: Updates published here do not get published to Microsoft Update live production.
segment.target: Updates published here do not get published to Microsoft Update live production.

segment.source: The SourceFirmwareSubmissionTicketId is the ticket ID of the firmware submission devices update from.
segment.target: The SourceFirmwareSubmissionTicketId is the ticket ID of the firmware submission devices update from.

segment.source: This is only required if phones are updating to Windows Phone 8.1 or higher.
segment.target: This is only required if phones are updating to Windows Phone 8.1 or higher.

segment.source: To guard against publishing updates that could potentially cause update errors, the Windows Phone device update publishing service reserves the right to reject RFUs that do not include the SourceFirmwareSubmissionTicketId of the previous update.
segment.target: To guard against publishing updates that could potentially cause update errors, the Windows Phone device update publishing service reserves the right to reject RFUs that do not include the SourceFirmwareSubmissionTicketId of the previous update.

segment.source: For more info on versioning, see Update requirements.
segment.target: For more info on versioning, see Update requirements.

segment.source: The OemDeviceName is the name at which the request for update is being targeted.
segment.target: The OemDeviceName is the name at which the request for update is being targeted.

segment.source: This is only required if device are updating to Windows Phone 8.1 or higher.
segment.target: This is only required if device are updating to Windows Phone 8.1 or higher.

segment.source: The MOId is the mobile operator at which the request for update is being targeted.
segment.target: The MOId is the mobile operator at which the request for update is being targeted.

segment.source: Scenario: Create a new RFU for use in retail servicing
segment.target: Scenario: Create a new RFU for use in retail servicing

segment.target: A firmware signing request has been successfully submitted.

segment.target: The firmware signing request ticket number is available.

segment.source: There is a desire to submit a new request for update for retail servicing.
segment.target: There is a desire to submit a new request for update for retail servicing.
